TopicTitle: If you could change any one decision in the 20th century what would you do?

Articles.Content: I would let hitler in to art school, wouldn't have gone into politics and (indirectly) killed millions of people

I would make net neutrality Law solid to preserve The rights of end users * YOU !* .

EDIT : no ones data is more important then others . ya want speed .. pay for it .

I would let hitler in to art school, wouldn't have gone into politics and (indirectly) killed millions of people

I don't think that was the only reason for him going into politics.I would've got him shot in WWI.

I don't think that was the only reason for him going into politics.I would've got him shot in WWI.

It would have helped
Every. Single. Damned. Budget. Cut. On. NASA!!
I would stop Kenedy of getting killed, I wonder what he would have say if he had seen the fruit of the NASA work...

Just for giggles, I would have the United States side with the Eastern Powers in WW1. Think about how different the early part of the 20th century would have been if Germany had won instead of France.
Will you guys stop killing Hitler? WWII is kind of responsible for the meeting of my grandparents, and I'd like to continue existing, if that's okay with y'all.

Mine too.

I want my place here, thank you very much!

Will you guys stop killing Hitler? WWII is kind of responsible for the meeting of my grandparents, and I'd like to continue existing, if that's okay with y'all.

Then this thread is stupid. Which is why I shall join in.

I would like people to not ditch researching AI in the 50's

Will you guys stop killing Hitler? WWII is kind of responsible for the meeting of my grandparents, and I'd like to continue existing, if that's okay with y'all.

Don't worry.

Einstein demonstrated in Red Alert that WW2 would still happen if you kill hitler !

One demonstration does not make for certainty... The Butterfly Effect takes many forms.

Anyhow... I don't think there's anything of note worth changing in the 20th Century, unless I can somehow prevent the Cold War by the simple reversal of one single decision.
Just for fun: Let Richard Feynman go to Tuva.

One demonstration does not make for certainty... The Butterfly Effect takes many forms.

Anyhow... I don't think there's anything of note worth changing in the 20th Century, unless I can somehow prevent the Cold War by the simple reversal of one single decision.

There's no real start, which makes it difficult. The Cold War did start the Space Race, which lead to many breakthroughs in tech. And KSP would probably not exist, or be a sci-fi game.

The stopping of the Apollo Program.

and what would that acomplish?

I would raise funding to nasa
Stop the saboting of the germany wartime nuclear program... And grab some popcorn...
